{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3276151,"name":"Ryan Yohnk","username":"yohnkrb","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/yohnkrb/{size}/184829_2.png","created_at":"2024-01-08T01:47:58.341Z","cooked":"

Evening CD!

In preparation for next week, I spent some time tonight playing around with different vision coprocessors. One of the options I’m very intrigued by is utilizing the OrangePi 5 (not Plus) with PhotonVision. My tests this evening have been a bit bumpy.

Before I dive in more to see where I’m stumbling, I wanted to check with the community and see if anyone’s had success in this area. Mainly…

  • Is anyone successfully using PhotonVision, an OrangePi 5, and a USB cameras?
  • What model of USB cameras are people finding success with?
  • Are people installing the OrangePi supplied OS and installing PV on top of that or utilizing the OrangePi image directly from PV?
  • Anyone successfully get multiple USB cameras working on the OrangePi?

Thanks everyone, I appreciate any input!

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2024-01-08T01:47:58.341Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":444,"reads":333,"readers_count":332,"score":2286.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":448393,"topic_slug":"orangepi-5-photonvision","display_username":"Ryan Yohnk","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://github.com/PhotonVision/photonvision/releases","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Releases · PhotonVision/photonvision · GitHub","clicks":10},{"url":"https://docs.photonvision.org/en/latest/docs/installation/sw_install/other-coprocessors.html","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Other Debian-Based Co-Processor Installation - PhotonVision Docs","clicks":8},{"url":"http://www.orangepi.org/html/hardWare/computerAndMicrocontrollers/service-and-support/Orange-pi-5.html","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Orange Pi - Orangepi","clicks":8}],"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":45842,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/orangepi-5-photonvision/448393/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3276165,"name":"Paul Rensing","username":"prensing","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/prensing/{size}/65820_2.png","created_at":"2024-01-08T01:58:11.230Z","cooked":"

Absolutely it can work. Many people, my team included, used it all last season.

We used 1 arducam ov9281usb camera on 1 Opi5. I know others used multiple on the same processor.

You might be having trouble with the latest version (depending on what you are trying). There have been a lot of changes this past few months and there probably are bugs to work out. Consider posting details on the PV Discord.

Good to hear! I struggled to get my Logitech Brio or Dell UltraSharp camera to show up on both the current and last stable release. But I need to do more digging.

Did last year’s version have any type of game piece detection built in? Ultimately that’s what I’d love to see our team move towards.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2024-01-08T02:17:28.569Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":5,"reads":273,"readers_count":272,"score":84.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":448393,"topic_slug":"orangepi-5-photonvision","display_username":"Ryan Yohnk","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":45842,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/orangepi-5-photonvision/448393/3","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3276189,"name":"","username":"mdurrani834","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mdurrani834/{size}/131246_2.png","created_at":"2024-01-08T02:22:19.950Z","cooked":"
yohnkrb:

Logitech Brio

This camera is not supported (logitech drivers cause issues) and I haven’t heard anyone try the ultra sharp but wouldnt be suprised if that didn’t play nice with CSCore (how PV’s camera handling works) either.

I reccomend looking at Selecting Hardware - PhotonVision Docs.

yohnkrb:

Did last year’s version have any type of game piece detection built in? Ultimately that’s what I’d love to see our team move towards.

There is the colored shape pipeline ( Contour Filtering and Grouping - PhotonVision Docs), but no ML Pipelines at the moment.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2024-01-08T02:22:53.126Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":12,"reads":260,"readers_count":259,"score":142.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":448393,"topic_slug":"orangepi-5-photonvision","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://docs.photonvision.org/en/latest/docs/hardware/selecting-hardware.html","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Selecting Hardware - PhotonVision Docs","clicks":33},{"url":"https://docs.photonvision.org/en/latest/docs/reflectiveAndShape/contour-filtering.html#colored-shape","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Contour Filtering and Grouping - PhotonVision Docs","clicks":4}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":34970,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/orangepi-5-photonvision/448393/4","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3278168,"name":"acastagna","username":"acastagna","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/a/a88e4f/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-01-09T15:13:38.885Z","cooked":"

We also tested the orangepi with arducam ov9281 and the 2023 image -it seems to work well.

However, I just tried the 2024 image and I get the message below. Tried with both the 2024 beta version and the newly releases 2024.1.2 and got similar errors. Not sure if it’s something I’m missing or an issue in the release. I’m guessing the mismatched versions is causing an issue in getting the results?

The orangepi is definitely running photonvision. We can see the processed stream in the web dashboard, and the targeting data.

Any suggestions?

Photon version v2024.1.1-beta-3.2 does not match coprocessor version v2023.4.2!
Warning at org.photonvision.PhotonCamera.verifyVersion(PhotonCamera.java:434): Photon version v2024.1.1-beta-3.2 does not match coprocessor version v2023.4.2!

The above stacktrace can help determine where the error occurred.

acastagna:

Any suggestions?

Photon version v2024.1.1-beta-3.2 does not match coprocessor version v2023.4.2!

The coprocesser version is still reporting v2023.4.2 in network tables.

Additionally, the actual error shows that the rawBytes entry does not have enough bytes to decode. This is an expected failure mode if your robot code is parsing the bytes assuming the 2024 format, but the coprocessor is producing bytes with the 2023 format.

Are you certain the new version is installed on your coprocessor?
